content.description: Pull on with compression on sidepulls (I think, see photo..). And climb the belly feature.
content.location: Just downhill and south from the prominent Fukness Boulder.  Facing north.  The problem Angular Sensations faces this and is 10 feet away maybe.

content.description: Vacation grades hell yeah.  Start wide in the pit.  Left hand on a flat halfpad crimp, right wide on the arete (see photo).  You probably will bump right up the arete then Dyno to the lip and mantle.  Yup, two moves oh hell yeah.
content.protection: Not many.. a blubber and a pad or two.
content.location: Just below the Fuckness.  An overhanging shield of ancient ocean bottom rock.  It faces north.

content.description: From a sit, squeezing the slabby diamond-like feature, climb up and left with difficulty and trickery.
content.location: Just downhill and right of the prominent Fuckness boulder.

content.description: A pretty wild one! Start with your left hand in a blocky gaston and right on a faint slipper next to it.  With some awkwardness set an extended, and aggressive toehook out right to establish on the problem.  Probably ride the toehook and shuffle out the right side of the roof to a somewhat easing finish.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter
content.location: Just above the Fuckness boulder in a big cave.

content.description: Start with a pinch on the lip for the left hand, and a lower edge for the right (see photo), gain the right arete and top out.  A right exit to Oak Savanna with a slightly different start.
content.location: Just on top of the prominent Fuckness boulder and facing north.

content.description: Start matched on a sweet pinch.  Mantle directly up.
content.location: Sitting on top of the prominent fuckness boulder on the north side and facing north.

content.description: Start high, matched in the obvious slot or perhaps do a couple campus moves into it.  Move right, somehow gaining the big horn feature and finish it up.
content.protection: Pads, including a couple sliders for surrounding boulders and a good spotter or two.
content.location: Just right of the Fukness Boulder.

content.description: Starting with a jug a chest level on the left arete, climb rightwards through the face on seams and crimps to a not so bad top out.  Get on this thing, it's a fun hard problem.
content.protection: I used 3 big pads and a small.  The landing is quite jumbled.
content.location: From the south shore beach, walk along the train tracks north.  Near the middle of the lake there is fencing below a talus field.  Look up, and The Fukness is on the Heartbreak Boulder, facing you, 40 or fifty feet up in the talus.

content.description: Start on the big jug on the arete that shares the start of the Fukness, but climb directly up the arete and face holds.  Serves as a nice warm-up to do a few laps on.
content.location: North side of the Fukness boulder

content.description: Start in the the dihedral in the hole, matched on the lip (see photo).  Climb up via tense moves.
content.location: Downhill and just north of the prominent Fuckness boulder.  On the same boulder as Angular Sensations and facing the lake.

content.description: Start on the left side of arete on jug and go up using cool sidepulls, topout rolling up over to the right.

climbs.name: Angular Sensations
climbs.fa: Ben Summay and Ian CB maybe

content.description: Start sitting with a rightward facing jug, and possibly a heal hook.  Climb the overhanging arete feature through good angular holds and mantle it out.
content.location: Just downhill and north from the prominent Fukness boulder and facing south.

content.description: This boulder has both an overhanging side and a slabby side.
